article_title: Texans owner gives boost to company working to protect athletes
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

article_metadata.description: Texans owner pitches in $25,000 toward developing product that measures head impacts in women soccer players  An emerging Houston technology company, developing a product to measure head impacts in women's soccer, received a $25,000 funding boost Friday from Houston Texans owner Bob McNair and his organization The McNair Group.  Stéphane Smith, co-founder and CEO of Integrated Bionics, said he believes The McNair Group and Integrated Bionics have an "alignment of interest" on improving the health and performance of athletes.  Scott Schwinger, president and CEO of The McNair Group, said the investment was more about timing - Integrated Bionics came recommended because it's in the right development stage - but he emphasized that the organizations are now partners and can help each other out.  The McNair Group will invest $1 million annually to help emerging technology companies over the next three years.
article_metadata.author.name: By Andrea Rumbaugh
